required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Ruboxistaurin on Clinically Significant Macular Edema
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Ruboxistaurin on Vision Loss in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus and Clinically Significant Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to test the hypothesis that oral administration of ruboxistaurin will reduce the occurrence of sustained moderate visual loss (SMVL) in patients with clinically significant macular edema. SMVL is defined as a 15 letter or more decrease from baseline in best-corrected Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity that is sustained for the patient's last 6 months of study participation. The SMVL data from this study will be combined with the SMVL data from Study B7A-MC-MBDL for the purpose of comparing ruboxistaurin to placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Moderate Visual Loss (SMVL) Any Time Baseline Through Month 48
primary_outcome.description: SMVL is defined as a 15 letter or more decrease from baseline in best-corrected Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity that is sustained for the participant's last 6 months of study participation. ETDRS visual acuity uses an eye chart with 5 letters per line. The scores range from 0 (no letters read correctly) to 100 (all letters read correctly).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Month 24 in Mean Retinal Thickness Within 500 Microns of the Center of the Macula
secondary_outcome.description: Least Squares (LS) Mean values were controlled for treatment, pooled center, and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Significant Center-Involved Macular Edema at Any Time From Baseline Through Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Significant center-involved macular edema is defined as an absolute retinal thickness at the center of the macula >2 standard deviations above the mean baseline value (where the mean and standard deviation are calculated at baseline from the randomized population of participants with retinal thickness values of ≤ 300 microns in depth).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Month 24 in Contrast Sensitivity
secondary_outcome.description: Values are presented as changes in the number of letters read correctly on the Pelli-Robson contrast sensitivity chart which consists of 16 triplets (48 letters total) with letters of the same size but decreasing contrast. Least Squares (LS) Mean values were controlled for treatment, pooled center, and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Month 24 in Retinal Thickness at the Center of the Macula
Number of Participants Requiring Focal Photocoagulation at Any Time From Baseline Through Month 24
Number of Participants Not Requiring Focal Photocoagulation at Any Time From Baseline Through Month 24
Number of Participants Requiring Repeat Focal Photocoagulation at Any Time From Baseline Though Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Repeat focal photocoagulation is defined as 2 or more focal photocoagulation treatments needed during the study.

arm_group.description: 32 mg taken orally daily for up to 48 months
Taken orally daily for up to 48 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 or 2 diabetes
- 18 years or older
- Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) less than or equal to 11%
- Mild to very severe non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy in the study eye
- Clinically significant macular edema in the study eye not within 100 microns of center of macula
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgery or laser treatment (or need for laser treatment within 3 months) in the study eye
- Glaucoma in the study eye
- Unstable cardiovascular disease
- Major surgery within past 3 months
- Significantly impaired kidney or liver function, or malignancy requiring chemotherapy or radiation therapy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Moderate Visual Loss (SMVL) Any Time Baseline Through Month 48
outcome.description: SMVL is defined as a 15 letter or more decrease from baseline in best-corrected Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity that is sustained for the participant's last 6 months of study participation. ETDRS visual acuity uses an eye chart with 5 letters per line. The scores range from 0 (no letters read correctly) to 100 (all letters read correctly).
outcome.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had post-baseline SMVL measurements.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Moderate Visual Loss (SMVL) Any Time Baseline Through Month 48
measure.description: SMVL is defined as a 15 letter or more decrease from baseline in best-corrected Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) visual acuity that is sustained for the participant's last 6 months of study participation. ETDRS visual acuity uses an eye chart with 5 letters per line. The scores range from 0 (no letters read correctly) to 100 (all letters read correctly).
measure.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had post-baseline SMVL measurements.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Month 24 in Mean Retinal Thickness Within 500 Microns of the Center of the Macula
outcome.description: Least Squares (LS) Mean values were controlled for treatment, pooled center, and baseline value.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had both baseline and post-baseline retinal thickness measurements.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Month 24 in Contrast Sensitivity
outcome.description: Values are presented as changes in the number of letters read correctly on the Pelli-Robson contrast sensitivity chart which consists of 16 triplets (48 letters total) with letters of the same size but decreasing contrast. Least Squares (LS) Mean values were controlled for treatment, pooled center, and baseline value.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had both baseline and post-baseline contrast sensitivity measurements.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
